name: 3Sum

similar_questions.title: Minimum Sum of Mountain Triplets I
Minimum Sum of Mountain Triplets II

title: 3Sum
content:
Given an integer array nums, return all the triplets [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] such that i != j, i != k, and j != k, and nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0.

Notice that the solution set must not contain duplicate triplets.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [-1,0,1,2,-1,-4]
Output: [[-1,-1,2],[-1,0,1]]
Explanation: 
nums[0] + nums[1] + nums[2] = (-1) + 0 + 1 = 0.
nums[1] + nums[2] + nums[4] = 0 + 1 + (-1) = 0.
nums[0] + nums[3] + nums[4] = (-1) + 2 + (-1) = 0.
The distinct triplets are [-1,0,1] and [-1,-1,2].
Notice that the order of the output and the order of the triplets does not matter.

Example 2:

Input: nums = [0,1,1]
Output: []
Explanation: The only possible triplet does not sum up to 0.

Example 3:

Input: nums = [0,0,0]
Output: [[0,0,0]]
Explanation: The only possible triplet sums up to 0.

 

Constraints:

  • 3 <= nums.length <= 3000
  • -105 <= nums[i] <= 105

discussion_posts.name: alpon
discussion_posts.content:
Question about test case:
[-1,0,1,2,-1,-4]
It is said that the right answer for this case will be
[[-1,-1,2],[-1,0,1]]
That is confusing, because if we say that elements '-1' (first in array) and '-1'(5th in array) are different( that is why we have sub array[-1,-1,2] in the answer) the real answer must be the following
[[-1,0,1],[-1,0, 1],[-1,2,-1]]
because we have different "-1" in array.
Please correct test cases or refine problem description to avoid ambiguity.

discussion_posts.name: Xlaton
discussion_posts.content:
1.	Sort the given array in non-decreasing order.
2.	Loop through the array from index 0 to n-1.
3.	For each iteration, set the target as -nums[i].
4.	Set two pointers, j=i+1 and k=n-1.
5.	While j<k, check if nums[j]+nums[k]==target.
6.	If yes, add the triplet {nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]} to the result and move j to the right and k to the left.
7.	If no, move either j or k based on the comparison of nums[j]+nums[k] with target.
8.	To avoid duplicate triplets, skip the iterations where nums[i]==nums[i-1] and also skip the iterations where nums[j]==nums[j-1] or nums[k]==nums[k+1].

discussion_posts.name: quantized
discussion_posts.content: The same solution that ran in less than 28ms 1.5 years ago takes 80 ms now. I wonder how they calculate the percentile when they are not consistent with computes.\n![image](https://s3-lc-upload.s3.amazonaws.com/users/quantized/image_1529815142.png)\n

discussion_posts.name: Somian
discussion_posts.content:
Your answer

[[1,0,-1],[-1,2,-1]]
Expected answer

[[-1,-1,2],[-1,0,1]]

The description doens't say anything about the order the values shold be returned in.

This means that my solution isn't correct, even though it returns the correct numbers (just in a different order).

Because it doens't say anything about how the order needs to be, there is also no way to fix it other than trying different algorithms.

discussion_posts.name: susmitpy
discussion_posts.content:
Given an integer array nums, return all the triplets [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] such that i != j, i != k, and j != k, and nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0.
Example given:
Input: nums = [-1,0,1,2,-1,-4]
Output: [[-1,-1,2],[-1,0,1]]

For the first triplet, i is -1 and j is also -1 but in the probem statement it is clearly mentioned that i != j

   Why ? Sizes of the arrays are always 3, right ?

discussion_posts.name: forainychen
discussion_posts.content: For example, nlog(n)? since we have sort the array, it seems like we might able to do better.

discussion_posts.name: himanshugullaiya
discussion_posts.content:
Testcase : [-4,-2,-2,-2,0,1,2,2,2,3,3,4,4,6,6]

Leetcode Expected Output :[[-4,-2,6],[-4,0,4],[-4,1,3],[-4,2,2],[-2,0,2]]

My Output : [[-4,-2,6],[-4,0,4],[-4,1,3],[-4,2,2],[-2,-2,4],[-2,0,2]]

I think [-2,-2,4]should also be in the answer as it is not duplicate and is missing in expected output. What are your thoughts guys?

discussion_posts.name: Johnny-Cui
discussion_posts.content:
It said the shuold return unique triple ,then in the following example what is the uique example?
\xB7\xB7\xB7
Input = [-1,0,1,2,-1]
\xB7\xB7\xB7

Note that there are two -1, so  corresponding to the result triple (-1,0,1) there are two result with diffrent indexes,  they are [-1.0,1] and [0,1,-1],
in this case are there the same triple or not ?  This is the reason why I think this question is not clear
